The Chancellor has big questions to answer. 

He must urgently explain how much he has benefited at the same time he was putting taxes up for millions of working families and choosing to leave them £2620 a year worse off. https://t.co/58gXghFaDB

I don't understand why the Government has dropped plans to improve flexibility at work.

This is an awful decision especially for parents and carers.

My Flexible Working Bill, which has cross-party support, would make flexible working a right for all.

As I say here, this poorly-judged gimmick shows how out of touch Rishi Sunak is with the cost of living crisis facing families, pensioners and businesses.

Under this govt, crypto firms linked to criminal gangs have been left to trade freely. It’s time to regulate the sector.
https://t.co/gMUPvi4axo https://t.co/gMUPvi4axo

I'm very pleased that the Foreign Affairs Committee have agreed to an inquiry into Nazanin’s case and state hostage taking.

Richard Ratcliffe & I called for an inquiry as soon as Nazanin returned home, as lessons must be learnt to ensure this never happens again. #NazaninIsFree

As I say here, the crypto sector could bring enormous benefits to our economy.

But under the Conservatives, crypto firms responsible for scams and money laundering have been able to trade without sanction.

It's time to regulate the sector properly.

https://t.co/Wai0xXlYfP

This high tax, low growth Conservative Government has pushed millions of people into debt.

https://t.co/1QpsLpXKC9

As Rachel says here the Chancellor hasn’t got a clue. He needs to spend one day in my inbox and he’ll see how affected my constituents are by rising food prices, energy bill and the cost of living crisis. https://t.co/I1FgFmECPw

So proud of all the amazing staff at the @RoyalFreeNHS! Please tune in to @BBCTwo at 9pm to watch #Hospital.

We owe them so much. https://t.co/FfBmQ3hiiZ

As I say here, yesterday the Chancellor should have put a windfall tax on the fuel giants who describe the cost of living crisis as a “cash machine”.

Instead, he put the highest tax burden on working people since the 1940s.

The public deserve better.

https://t.co/nzD4vk1daD
‘There’s a special place in hell for women who don’t help each other’ RIP Madeleine Albright - what a woman.

On the @BBCRadio4 PM programme earlier, I pointed out that the Chancellor has introduced the biggest tax burden in 70 years and is pushing families into hardship.

For every £6 he is taking away from people in tax rises, his #SpringStatement will give just £1 back. https://t.co/4NfGl9RXr9

I was just on @talkRADIO speaking about Labour's plan for a windfall tax on oil and gas producers to help families with their energy bills.

It is disappointing that the Chancellor didn't adopt this  in his #SpringStatement, which will do nothing to fix the cost of living crisis. https://t.co/4eFpDulQaa

As @RachelReevesMP says, this Chancellor is the only one in the G7 who is raising taxes on working people in this difficult period.

The Conservatives are making the wrong choices. Energy prices will rise by 52% in 8 days time, with devastating impacts on families and businesses.

Excellent speech from @RachelReevesMP who is setting out Labour's plan to get the economy firing on all cylinders by buying, making and selling more in Britain.

The Chancellor is promising jam tomorrow rather than putting forward a plan for growth and productivity today.

"People can no longer afford the Conservatives".

👏 @RachelReevesMP

This Chancellor has also been funding crime rather than fighting it. He has lost a staggering £11.8 billion of public money to criminal fraudsters.

Now he has the audacity to ask the taxpayer to fork out more in National Insurance to pay for this failure.

@RachelReevesMP points out that the Chancellor continues to defend the record profits of the oil and gas producers, who admit they have “more money than we know what to do with" and are making record profits.

The cost-of-living crisis long pre-dates the Ukraine crisis. 

Families are already struggling to pay their fuel bills, and 10 million more people could now be pushed into poverty.

The Chancellor has no plan to tackle this.

As @RachelReevesMP says, the Chancellor could have today chosen to bring in a windfall tax, provide real support to businesses and scrap the NI tax rise. He didn't.

The Conservatives don't understand the scale of the cost of living crisis, and their choices are making it worse.

Last week, I met with @CeeneyNatalie and @CatFarrow1 from the Access to Cash Action Group to discuss how we can make sure no one is left behind in the age of digital banking.

The Government must introduce legislation to protect access to cash and face-to-face banking services. https://t.co/P17PGC72B1

It’s standard for legislation to give children extra protection - it’s absurd the government see this as a problem. That’s why it’s vital to support amendment 27 to the #NationalityandBordersBill to protect child victims and ensure decisions are made in their best interests.

Nazanin and I were laughing about how we colour coordinated for our first public appearance together.

It wasn’t intentional! But great minds think alike and all that. 8/8

#NazaninIsFree https://t.co/HjPRcROlNt

A cheeky selfie with the family and some of my staff members after lunch on the Parliament Terrace.

You might have seen the official photos, but here are some behind the scenes shots 😬 1/8 https://t.co/DtXKUmT1Jp

Today I gave a speech in Parliament on how fraud has rocketed under the Tories.

The Business Secretary was completely wrong to suggest that fraud is a lesser crime. This lack of interest saw reports of fraud rise by 33% in 2021. 

Fraud destroys lives - it's time for action. https://t.co/ECMvLdWztY

📺 Watch my statement in Parliament this afternoon on the return of my constituent Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe.

#NazaninIsFree https://t.co/vMxsdTTLbA

Nazanin’s plane took off from Oman just over half an hour ago and she’s due to arrive in the UK this evening.

#NazaninIsFree https://t.co/YN2AHA6jVR

#NazaninIsFree https://t.co/yx2U3Q3DF6

I’ve just heard from Richard Ratcliffe that Nazanin has touched down in Muscat, from where she’ll board a flight to the UK.

If I missed anyone else out I am sorry - but I haven't had much sleep in the last few days! There are (literally) millions of people who signed, wrote, cheered, sang and campaigned for Nazanin's release - thank you all! 5/5

#NazaninIsFree
Speakers past and present have supported Nazanin's fight for freedom - as well as Ambassadors, local councillors across the country and journalists who have not let her name disappear from view 4/

Not forgetting the wide spectrum of MPs from all parties who supported this campaign from day one - SNP, Conservatives, Lib Dems, Green, SDLP, the DUP.

Of course Richard's family who have provided love, support and energy when he needed it - his sister, brother, mum and dad. 3/

The FCDO and the Foreign Secretary for taking a personal interest in Nazanin's case, Redress, Gibson Dunn, @UKChange and Amnesty for campaigning, all of Nazanin's local community (and especially those neighbours in West Hampstead who have been steadfast in their support) 2/

There are so many people who have worked so hard for so long to #FreeNazanin.

Now she is finally on a flight back to be reunited with her family, I wanted to share my thanks for all those who helped.

Firstly, thanks to her amazing husband Richard, who has been a rock. 1/

It's been 6 long years - and I can't believe I can FINALLY share this photo.

Nazanin is now in the air flying away from 6 years of hell in Iran.

My heart goes out to Gabriella and Richard, as her long journey back home to them gets closer by the minute.

#NazaninIsFree ❤️ https://t.co/BzEEBP840C

Nazanin is at the airport in Tehran and on her way home.

I came into politics to make a difference, and right now I’m feeling like I have.

#FreeNazanin

Thank you all so much for your concern and supportive messages about my constituents in Ukraine.

I’m very pleased to say that Ben and Alice have acquired their emergency travel documents and should be flying home tomorrow. Thanks to those at @FCDOGovUK who helped.

The situation in Ukraine is extremely concerning and I know many are trapped and struggling to get consular assistance. 

Any constituents in need of support can get in touch with me by emailing tulip@tulipsiddiq.com and I’ll do everything I can to help.

Thanks to everyone who has contacted me about my constituents Alice & Ben who are stuck in Ukraine. 

I’ve been assisting them for over a month now and have raised the case directly with James Cleverly.

I’m working as hard as I can to get them home along with their baby Raphael.
@AJogee You get to canvass with me tomorrow! 🥳
